oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Zion Hill Baptist: church building
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of Zion Hill Baptist Church. The gable-fronted building features nine-over-nine, double-hung windows, a shed-roofed portico, and wheelchair ramp. A prominent steeple projects from the roof. A rear addition meets the main section in a L-shaped plan. A parking lot sits to the side of the building.
Established in 1892, Zion Hill Baptist Church is a rural African American church in Crockett County, Tennessee. The current building, circa 1980s-1990s, sits across the road from a large cemetery.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; Baptist church buildings
